sentences.english: A swoosh doesn’t make it good design. It’s just lazy.
sentences.chinese: 旋風產非好的設計，而是一種懶惰。

sentences.english: Idless is the sail of self-pity and depression.
sentences.chinese: 懶惰是催生消沉和自憐自哀的土壤。

sentences.english: The natural day is very calm, and will hardly reprove his indolence.
sentences.chinese: 時光的天性就是沉靜，它不會因此而責備自己的懶惰。

sentences.english: Thus, lazy operators are used to solve this problem.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我們添加“懶惰”限定符來解決問題。

sentences.english: Slackness can also appear in the quality of work.
sentences.chinese: 懶惰也會在工作質量上有所體現。

sentences.english: It is just blatantly and brutally LAZY and TIRED.
sentences.chinese: 完全就是喫果果的令人髮指的懶惰和疲乏。

sentences.english: Differentiating between greediness and laziness is key to fully understanding advanced regular expressions.
sentences.chinese: 理解貪婪與懶惰的區別是運用高級正則表達式的基礎。

sentences.english: We may procrastinate because we are not sure what to do next.
sentences.chinese: 我們可能會因爲不知道下一步該幹什麼而懶惰。

sentences.english: Sloth turneth the bend of wit.
sentences.chinese: 懶惰能磨去才智的矛頭。

sentences.english: However, we must not fall into a "slacktivist" mindset.
sentences.chinese: 但是，我們決不能陷入懶惰的行動者的心態。

sentences.english: You are not lazy, and still you are an idler.
sentences.chinese: 你並不懶惰，但卻算得上是個遊手好閒的人。

sentences.english: So if you'd like to ask a question, come to one of the mikes .
sentences.chinese: 所以如果你想要問一個問題，到達懶惰之一。

sentences.english: One point of lazy is most favorable, that is, everybody knows it without being taught.
sentences.chinese: “懶惰”有一點特別招人喜歡，那就是不用學就會。

sentences.english: He reproached his son with laziness.
If you are lazy, you will diligently find ways not to work.
sentences.chinese: 如果你很懶惰，你將會致力於尋找不工作的方法。

sentences.english: The sluggard is like a lump of dung; whoever touches him wipes his hands.
sentences.chinese: 懶惰人好比一堆牛糞，摸着的人，都將它從手中抖掉。

definition: to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
habit/custom/usual practice/to be used to/CL:個|个[ge4]
